results.title: Sights of London
results.brief_description: Shows well-known streets, buildings, churches, shopping centres and other parts of London, including the Tower, and the Nelson Column, of general interest to the tourist. One sequence shows the procession to celebrate the silver wedding of King George VI and Queen Elizabeth.

results.title: Sight...unseen
results.creator_credit: Paul Davoud, Australian Science Education Project and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description: Shows a range of educational activities at the North Rocks School for blind children. Braille music, braille typewriters and other tactile and mobility aids are demonstrated. Suitable for tertiary and teacher levels.

results.title: Sight and sound
results.creator_credit: Gudrun Parker, Nathan Clavier, Don Mulholland and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Lessons take on new life and meaning for children through the magic of films, filmstrips and radio. Everybody goes to the movies, and directly or indirectly learns much of the world. If ordinary movies illumine minds, how much more can be done with specially designed films in schools. We see, for example, how through a film, a class of children “jumps a continent” to visit Mexico, how a filmstrip on cutouts stimulates creative activity; how a radio broadcast can make what might have been a drab history period spring into new, imaginative life. Thanks to “sight and sound,” learning becomes an adventure.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Gudrun Parker, Nathan Clavier, Don Mulholland and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Sigaalow: Town of dust
results.creator_credit: Leslie Jenkins, United Nations and Office of the United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees
results.brief_description: Examines the problems relating to living conditions faced by Somalian refugees from the Ogaden. Shows the efforts being made by the Somali government to deal with these problems and the need for International Aid.

results.title: Sierra Leone greets the Queen
results.brief_description: Royal tour of Sierra Leone by Her Majesty Queen Elizabeth II, and HRH Prince Philip, the Duke of Edinburgh, in 1961; State Drive to Freetown; a military parade and inspection, a Royal Durbar, a State Banquet and the Garden Party given for Her Majesty by Prime Minister, Sir Milton Margai. Visits to outstanding industrial projects and educational institutions and a wealth of colourful pageants and displays are other features of the tour.

results.title: Siegfried
results.creator_credit: Brian Large, Otto Schenk and Metropolitan Opera
results.brief_description: Siefried is the third part of Richard Wagner’s cycle of four operas known as “The Ring of the Nibelung”. This opera follows the adventures of Siefried (Siegfried Jerusalem) as he slays the dragon Fafner to gain possession of the ring which gives mastery of the world. He also rescues Brunhilde (Hildegard Behrens) from the ring of fire where she was imprisoned in “Die Walkure”, the second opera from the cycle. This Metropolitan Opera production of “Siegfried” is entertaining, with great sets and strong performances from the entire cast. The Metropolitan Opera Orchestra is conducted by James Levine. There is no subtitling, enabling the viewer to concentrate on the music and performances. Includes guide in English, Italian and German.

results.title: Siegfried
results.brief_description: The young God Siegfried, the subject of famed Teutonic legend achieves immortality by bathing in the blood of a slain dragon; one of the hallmark scenes in the history of silent film. An evocative film typical of Lang’s genius which deals with the theme of the extra-personal forces which shape the destiny of humans in a way they cannot always predict or control. “Siegfried” was a nationalistic triumph for Lang and an international success. A classic not to be missed.

results.title: Siege
results.creator_credit: Julien Bryan, Frank Donovan, Frederic Ullman, International Film Foundation and RKO Pathe Pictures
results.brief_description: Famous documentary by Julien Bryan on the invasion of Poland by the German army in September 1939 - the attack that began World War II. It captures, with powerful images, the terror and desperation of the refugees and the immense destruction in the cities and towns. Depicts the destructive effect on the lives of the people. An important work that shows how unprepared Poland was to face the German war machine. Depicts the first week of WWII, and includes quite graphic footage.

results.title: Sidney Nolan: Such Is Life
results.creator_credit: Brian Adams, William Leeson, Channel 4, Radio-Telefis Eirann (RTE), Ceidrik Heward, RM Arts and Waveband Film Productions
results.brief_description: Such is life is a biographical retrospective of Sidney Nolan’s life and work, told in a modern-day journey from Ireland to England, Hong Kong and Australia. Filmed against a background of Sidney Nolan’s past and current projects, it includes the designs for a new opera production for the Royal Opera House, Covent Garden, a large graphic suite on themes relevant to Australia’s Bicentennial during 1988 and exhibitions of his new work in London and Hong Kong.
